page.title: 11PLACES OF WORSHIP
page.content: There are seven Christian churches in this area but no Mosques or Temples. The {Church of England} is represented by St. Michael of All Angels and Christ the King in Tettenhall and the Epiphany in Oxley. Their ministers are the Revs. Makepeace, Fyfe and Preece. Their congregations number about 500. The {Nonconformist}churches are the Fordhouses Baptists and the Rakegate Methodists whose ministers are the Revs Smith and Field and have congregations of 150 and 25 respectively. The Holy Trinity{Catholic}church is especially for the Wolverhampton Polish community. Their priest is Fr. Matysik and it serves a congregation of 450. There is also an Italian Evangelical church serving a small congregation. All the churches except one have been built in the last 30 years due to the movement of population.
